intro: Voacanga micrantha, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a tropical climbing plant native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by elongated, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. Its roots and seeds contain alkaloids, which have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Due to its chemical composition, it is also of interest in ethnobotanical research.
